name: Price Decrease - Revenue Increase - Quantity Increment
name_hi: कीमत कमी - राजस्व वृद्धि - मात्रा वृद्धि

signature.embedding_text: If price of an item decreases by X percent and revenue increases by Y percent, find the increment in quantity or number of items

trick.name: Ratio Method
trick.one_liner: Revenue = Price × Quantity, use ratios to find quantity increment

steps.action_hi: Percentages ko ratios mein convert karo
steps.example: 1% price decrease → Price = 100 : 99, 83 1/3% revenue increase → Revenue = 6 : 11

steps.action: Find quantity ratio using Revenue = Price × Quantity
steps.action_hi: Revenue = Price × Quantity use karke quantity ratio nikalo

steps.action: Find increment in ratio units and scale to actual value
steps.action_hi: Ratio units mein increment nikalo aur actual value ke liye scale karo
steps.example: Increment = 50 - 27 = 23 units. If new quantity = 350, then 50 units = 350, so 1 unit = 7. Increment = 23 × 7 = 161
steps.example_hi: वृद्धि = 50 - 27 = 23 units. Agar नई मात्रा = 350, तो 50 units = 350, so 1 unit = 7. वृद्धि = 23 × 7 = 161

trick.formula: Quantity Ratio = (Original Revenue/Original Price) : (New Revenue/New Price), Increment = (Difference in ratio) × (Scaling factor)
trick.memory_hook: Price kam, revenue zyada → quantity zyada badhegi, ratio method se nikalo

common_mistakes.wrong: 1% price decrease, 83.33% revenue increase → 83.33% - 1% = 82.33% quantity increase
common_mistakes.right: Use ratio method: Price = 100:99, Revenue = 6:11, Quantity = 27:50, Increment = 23 units
common_mistakes.why: Revenue = Price × Quantity relationship ko properly handle karna padta hai, direct percentage nahi chalega

common_mistakes.wrong: Treating 'increased by 350' as increment instead of new total
common_mistakes.right: If new quantity = 350, find increment using ratio difference
common_mistakes.why: Question mein 'increased by 350' ka matlab new total hai, increment nahi

deep.explanation:
Concept: Revenue = Price × Quantity.

Agar price X% kam hoti hai aur revenue Y% badh jati hai, toh:
• Price ratio: 100 : (100-X)
• Revenue ratio: 100 : (100+Y) ya simplified ratio
• Quantity ratio = Revenue/Price = (R_old/P_old) : (R_new/P_new)

Example: 1% price decrease, 83 1/3% revenue increase
• Price = 100 : 99
• Revenue = 6 : 11 (83 1/3% = 5/6 increase, so 1 + 5/6 = 11/6, ratio = 6:11)
• Quantity = (6/100) : (11/99) = 27 : 50
• Increment = 50 - 27 = 23 units
• If new quantity = 350, then 50 units = 350, so 1 unit = 7
• Increment = 23 × 7 = 161

Yaad rakho:
• Ratio method use karo for clean calculation
• Revenue/Price = Quantity relationship ko maintain rakho
• Scaling factor se actual value nikalo

shortcut.explanation:
Quick trick:
1. Price decrease X% → Price = 100 : (100-X)
2. Revenue increase Y% → Convert to ratio (e.g., 83 1/3% = 5/6 → Revenue = 6 : 11)
3. Quantity = Revenue/Price ratio = (R_old/P_old) : (R_new/P_new)
4. Increment = Difference in ratio units
5. Scale using given new quantity value

instant.explanation: Price X% ↓, Revenue Y% ↑ → Quantity ratio = (R_old/P_old):(R_new/P_new), Increment = ratio difference × scaling factor
